comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: She was a Boston-based singer and music teacher, aka Caroline Gardner Clark Bartlett (1868-1938). More about "Sister Beatrice" and her wartime relief work with the Red Cross: trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/90768974 In Ottawa she was suspected of being a German spy: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F70F11F6385B17738... More photos of her here: www.parrotcreek.com/bartlett.htm More about her: books.google.com/books?id=FeXl-jdJlCkC&lpg=PA117&... I don't think she has a Wikipedia entry yet, but there's plenty of material to get one started.

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: And now she does have a Wikipedia entry: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caroline_Gardner_Bartlett

comment.author: 34911459@N08
comment._content: Thanks for the information.  We will update the record.
